clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Antibiotics During Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) Support
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Antibiotics During Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) Support

brief_summary.textblock: This study will measure plasma concentrations of piperacillin-tazobactam and cefazolin in pediatric patients supported with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) aiming to better understand the pharmacokinetics of these medications in this in vivo setting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Peri drug dose administration until cessation of antibiotic therapy or cessation of ECMO support up to a maximum of 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Drug levels will be checked at baseline followed by additional measurements after the dose based on the dosing intervals but anticipated to be 30, 60, 120, 360, 480 minutes after the dose. Dosing regime will be q8-12 hourly pending end organ function (at the discretion of the treating team). The study will be continued for the duration of the Antibiotic therapy whilst on ECMO support and for one set of samples following decannulation.

study_pop.textblock: All pediatric patients who are supported on ECMO at Boston Children's Hospital Cardiac Intensive Care Unit (CICU) and receive piperacillin-tazobactam or cefazolin as part of routine care or infection management.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- supported on ECMO
- receive piperacillin-tazobactam or cefazolin as part of routine care or infection management
Exclusion Criteria:
- >= 18 years
- No Consent provided
